text: Good morning everyone
good morning
morning
good moaning
just realised we haven’t had an android studio update in a while
I miss things being broken
There hasn’t been new releases since preview 4, and that’s been a while :confused:
Never update
Old software ftw
<@U08GFT5V5> is developing his stuff on winxp :smile:
How you know it’s safe to update is when end of life of the target platform has been announced
For example, it’s now safe to upgrade to python 2
I see
morning (an little bit late) :stuck_out_tongue:

Hello all
Can you give a clue what is the best way to put custom Fonts on the app?
<https://github.com/chrisjenx/Calligraphy> gives pretty good way to do it

attachments.title: chrisjenx/Calligraphy
attachments.text: Calligraphy - Custom fonts in Android the easy way...

text: I will take a look :wink: You already use this? Have a good performance on listviews?
Yes, I’ve used in several projects. If `TextView` already has same font it won’t do anything, so, should work fine
Ok many thanks!!
calligraphy or <https://github.com/ikocijan/MagicViews>

attachments.title: ikocijan/MagicViews
attachments.text: MagicViews - Set custom font in Android application

calligraphy do font caching?
yep <https://github.com/chrisjenx/Calligraphy/issues/148>

text: To properly upgrade projects for Android Studio 2+, is there a minimum gradle version they should be at or is it wise to just jump up to 2.10 or whatever is the latest? I believe most of my projects are on 2.8 and 2.9 currently.
Looking at the tooling notes the last comment on it was to use 2.0.0-alpha2 but that was back in early December.. oh but thats the gradle plugin nvm
wrapper or android plugin?
latest wrapper is 2.10
yes gradlew
so 2.10 works well with AS 2+ then?
yep
actually wait I’m on 2.8
but nothing breaking is there I think
alright
tho I don’t use the android plugin 2.0
We use both Gradle Wrapper 2.10, Android Studio 2.0 and Android Gradle Plugin 2.0
works fine
I use 2.9
well im not updating production products to use an alpha dependency =P
just trying to get ready as I assume the switch to release is happening soon for AS 2 and the plugin
and plugin 1.5.0
<@U055GGAHS>: ppfffft u scared homie?
<@U0548MM6B>: scared of alpha releases from Google engineers? Yes.. yes I am
:smile:
AS 2.0  is pretty stable
heh
mostly I dont want to look like an idiot when I miss an obvious issue and then I have to tell my boss it looks like the ‘alpha’ build tools messed up
because if I say that, he’s going to call me an idiot lol
playing it safe
lol

Well, my usual reason to sit on alphas/betas from Google:

Old version has bugs that we’ve reported and fix in the alpha/beta version
True. And especially if you waste too much of time on it
<@U091EBYSU>: yeah that makes sense but right now stable is working well
for us
<@U055GGAHS>: lol is that this process is recursive so we always sit on alphas/betas :smile:
/gif living on the edge
that guy is insane
ho lee shyt
oh and whats the status on the ‘experimental’ plugin
interns almost done with that?
lol not coming any time soon it seems
worst thing is that fucking 2.0.0-alpha123e12312squared makes me wait 40 minutes for the first build
hate that thing
fine with me.. im not looking forward to rewriting my plugins
all so I can use the ‘better’ plugin system

so let’s make a little Poll:

Do I take a weekend and use it to work and rewrite our app’s home activity (unpaid, but will help me a ton later)?
depends on your feelings to the project/company
I’d say no just because you always can talk to manager/etc  and do it in work hours or just do it without telling nobody
“soft skills"
<@U0548MM6B>: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jVkLVRt6c1U>

attachments.title: Mike Monteiro: F*ck You, Pay Me
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Mike Monteiro: F*ck You, Pay Me

text: can’t get it done during work since we’re chasing features and even tho they said refactor time I know it will be in a long long time
I go to my job because I like monies.. i dont dislike my job but when they aren’t paying me monies I sure as hell have no interest in doing it.
but this way I also get more Rx exercise
if you see it more as investment to yourself — then do it whenever you want :simple_smile:
well if its something you really want to do then do it.. but i wouldnt
i would start a personal project to learn whatever I want to learn
Is there any good gradle plugin for the entire build process: Builds, Auto increases version name and number, renames APK, uploads file somewhere etc etc
heh you just described all of my gradle plugins
I have somewhat managed to do it in bits and pieces
short answer is no
eh then I might just drop the plan :confused:
<@U0CT7JDN3>: so you want continous integration and deployment?
long answer is plugins do exist that solve some or all of these problems but when I looked they could not be molded to fit our build requirements which are specific for internal reasons
<@U0CT7JDN3>: <https://github.com/ToxicBakery/BettererNaming>

attachments.title: ToxicBakery/BettererNaming
attachments.text: BettererNaming - Gradle plugin for automatically renaming android artifacts into something more useful.

text: there is a lot of code out there for increasing version name and number, push it on CI and let it do everything
that one is public.. the rest of our stuff is internal
that was my first gradle plugin so it looks like shit.. my newer plugins also look like shit so im not implying I got any better at writing groovy bs
:joy:
:smile:
for our beta I just use the CI build version and let it rip via the play store publish plugin
in that plugin though specifically things like the logging need to be fixed as i didnt know how to do it properly and I believe the plugin has a way to get the apk name more sanely now
but if you have ever read the android plugin source.. it works with magic and undocumented hell
Heh :simple_smile:  Will go through it.
Might as well start writing my own plugins. Hopefully groovy’s learning curve is not steep.
hope you like javascript.. but worse
ouch, been meaning to go through the gradle course that google put out

Hey guys, I am planning to add animations to my android app. The problem is, I have no idea about animations, its rules, it’s types and what is possible in android. I have read the android documentation but could not figure out much. Do you guys know of any tutorials that I can go through to learn animations in android from very to basics to advanced. It would be helpful if I could get some real code and also get to see it’s effect then and there. Thanks.
Check out Plaid
oh god.. do not look at plaid as an intro to animations
or <https://github.com/frogermcs/InstaMaterial> posts

attachments.title: frogermcs/InstaMaterial
attachments.text: InstaMaterial - Implementation of Instagram with Material Design (originally based on Emmanuel Pacamalan's concept)

text: <@U055GGAHS>: why not? didnt look at the code much, did he do something terrible?
this is the one <https://github.com/nickbutcher/plaid>, right?

attachments.title: nickbutcher/plaid
attachments.text: Contribute to plaid development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: no its just a lot of information to absorb and if you are just starting out thats going to be overwhelming
I have seen Instamaterial. It is fabulous.
start here imo <https://www.udacity.com/course/material-design-for-android-developers--ud862>

attachments.title: Material Design for Android Developers
attachments.text: Learn and apply the material design principles that define Android's visual language to your apps.

text: that takes it slow and gives you some fundamentals
ok
if you dont have that much time you can try to survive just copying what you see in plaid
Thanks. I will start looking into it
np, good luck

hey guys, i am having problem with building my app. I am using cordova and when i run it i get error that i dont have $Android_home in $PATH.. but i do. And everything is setup correctly and worked until recently
i am using ubuntu
and can't figure out this problem
Add `export ANDROID_HOME=/your/path/to/android-sdk`  to `~/.bash_profile` (or `~/.bashrc`, I always forget which one for what)
.bash_profile
I imagine though what you really want is /etc/bash.bashrc as this should be a system wide property

when i do echo $path i get: /opt/idea/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games:/home/mladen/android-sdk-linux/tools:/home/mladen/android-sdk-linux/platform-tools
so it is there
i think i screwed something with linux permissions and groups
bc i need to run sudo cordova run android now
you can +x android
did just now, same error, failed to find android in your path
but when i do type android in terminal i do get SDK manager
weird
did you chmod +x or chmod a+x ?
:simple_smile: only +x
mistake
my next guess is cordova uses a different user so +x works for you but not for it
best option is to make it part of the user group I imagine but shortest is a+x cause wtf
a+x cordova?
no on android
i have no idea how cordova works so I cant tell you what its messing up
yeah, same thing
then it must not be seeing your path
try logging it out?
tried that
i think i typed chown with * at the end
i stopped it after few secs
what did you chown it to?
my group
user
but can't figure how to revert that
that’s what it really should be is in the user group
well i can't figure what else could i have done wrong...
i did update android though
